channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The gun that killed UnitedHealthcare’s CEO may have been a ‘very unique weapon’
item.description: Police are looking into the possibility that the shooter used a veterinary pistol, NYPD Chief of Detectives Joseph Kenny told reporters on Friday.

item.title: David Sacks and the coming crypto war over national security
Shares of Apollo Global Management and Workday rally as they
Syria’s Assad is under siege and is making overtures to US
item.description: Assad is ordering his army to fall back to defend Damascus, essentially ceding much of the country to insurgents.

item.title: The CEO of a state-run Russian banking giant admits the economy shows major signs of slowing
item.description: "We are now seeing significant signals of economic slowdown, particularly in housing construction and investment."

item.title: A retirement expert’s best advice? Don’t retire.
New US weapons package for Ukraine brings total in the past week to $1.7 billion — ‘The baton will soon be passed’
item.description: “Others will decide the course ahead. And I hope that they will build on the strength that we have forged over the past four years.”

item.title: How Peter Thiel’s network of right-wing techies is infiltrating Donald Trump’s White House
item.description: With David Sacks as “AI and Crypto Czar” and Elon Musk as co-head of DOGE, Thiel’s network has become closely tied to the new Trump administration.

item.title: Tesla’s stock closes at highest price in nearly 3 years. Why it can keep going.
Apollo Global Management, Workday shares rally as they're set to join S&P 500
